shortdesc.ph: Publishes the local stream to a specified CDN live streaming URL.

section.p: After calling this method, you can push media streams in RTMP or RTMPS protocol to the CDN. The SDK triggers the callback on the local client to report the state of adding a local stream to the CDN.

ul.li: Call this method after joining a channel.
Ensure that you enable the RTMP Converter service before using this function. See Prerequisites in the advanced guide Push Streams to CDN.
This method takes effect only when you are a host in live interactive streaming.
This method adds only one stream CDN streaming URL each time it is called. To push multiple URLs, call this method multiple times.
Agora supports pushing media streams in RTMPS protocol to the CDN only when you enable transcoding.

plentry.pd: CDN 推流地址，格式为 RTMP 或 RTMPS。 The maximum length of this parameter is 1024 bytes. The URL address must not contain special characters, such as Chinese language characters.

pd.p:
Whether to enable transcoding. in a CDN live streaming converts the audio and video streams before pushing them to the CDN server. It applies to scenarios where a channel has multiple broadcasters and composite layout is needed
: Enable transcoding.
: Disable transcoding.
pd.note: If you set this parameter as , ensure that you call the method before this method.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT(-2): Invalid argument, usually because the URL address is null or the string length is 0.
ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED(-7): You have not initialized the RTC engine when publishing the stream.
